inventory.vmRunningWarning: Stop the VM before deleting it

tabs.historyEmpty: Task history (starts, stops, migrations, snapshots, backups) will appear here.

inventory.noNotes: No notes for this VM. Click "Edit" to add one.
inventory.deleteSnapshotDesc: Deletes the snapshot (does not delete current data)
inventory.balloonMinHint: Proxmox can reclaim unused memory down to this minimum value.
inventory.balloonInfo: Ballooning allows Proxmox to dynamically reclaim unused memory from the VM. Disable it (balloon=0) if you encounter performance issues.
inventory.haQuorumRecommendation: High availability (HA) requires a cluster with quorum (3+ voting nodes) to function properly.
inventory.unlockHint: Run this command on the Proxmox node:
inventory.confirmEnterMaintenance: Do you want to put this node in maintenance mode? VMs will no longer be automatically migrated to this node.
inventory.confirmExitMaintenance: Do you want to exit maintenance mode for this node?
inventory.maintenanceModeActive: This node is currently in maintenance mode
inventory.maintenanceRequiresSsh: This action requires SSH to be configured on this connection.
inventory.pveFailoverError: PVE failed: {error}. Falling back to PBS...
inventory.rawDiskNotBrowsable: Raw disk images (.img.fidx) cannot be explored. Only .pxar archives support file-by-file restore.

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Account settings
settings.onboardingMessage: To start using ProxCenter, please add at least one connection to a Proxmox VE or PBS server.
settings.licenseManagement: Manage your ProxCenter license to access advanced features.
settings.ollamaDescription: Ollama allows running LLMs locally. No data is sent externally.
settings.openAiWarning: Requests will be sent to OpenAI servers. Make sure this complies with your security policies.
settings.anthropicWarning: Requests will be sent to Anthropic servers. Make sure this complies with your security policies.
settings.greenConfigDescription: Configure settings for calculating environmental impact and energy costs of your infrastructure.
settings.co2FactorExplanation: The emission factor varies by country's energy mix. France (nuclear) emits ~10x less CO₂ than Poland (coal).
settings.serverSpecsDescription: These settings help estimate the power consumption of your infrastructure.
settings.defaultPbsPort: Default PBS port: 8007 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.defaultPvePort: Default PVE port: 8006 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.ifDifferentFromApi: If different from API URL (e.g., via reverse proxy)
settings.appearanceDesc: Customize the overall appearance of ProxCenter. Changes are saved automatically.
settings.systemModeDesc: "System" mode automatically adapts to your OS preferences.
settings.backgroundTintDesc: Adjust the background color to reduce eye strain
settings.visualStyleDesc: Choose a global design that transforms the appearance of the entire interface
settings.uiScaleDesc: Adjust the overall interface size (ideal for high-resolution screens)
settings.blurIntensityDesc: Adjust the blur effect of transparent elements
settings.semiDarkMenuDesc: Keeps the menu in dark mode even in light theme
settings.pbsPortInfo: Default PBS port: 8007 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.pvePortInfo: Default PVE port: 8006 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.webInterfaceUrlHelper: If different from API URL (e.g., via reverse proxy)
settings.pvePrivsepHint: Ensure your API token was created with --privsep 0, or has explicit permissions assigned to the token itself (not just the user).
settings.confirmDeactivateLicense: Are you sure you want to deactivate your license?
settings.aiConfigDescription: Configure the AI assistant to interact with your infrastructure using natural language.
settings.enableAiAssistantDesc: Allows interacting with ProxCenter using natural language
settings.ollamaInfo: Ollama allows running LLMs locally. No data is sent externally.
settings.pueDescriptionFull:
PUE = Total datacenter energy / IT energy
Includes cooling, lighting, UPS, etc.
settings.electricityPriceHelper: Average price excl. tax from your provider
settings.co2FactorExplanationFull: The emission factor varies by country's energy mix. France (nuclear) emits ~10x less CO₂ than Poland (coal).
settings.serverSpecsDescriptionFull: These settings help estimate the power consumption of your infrastructure.
settings.avgCoresHelper: To estimate the number of servers
settings.generalTabInfo: This section will be enhanced soon with customization options.
settings.locationInfo: Set coordinates for the topology map.
settings.sshInfo: SSH access allows ProxCenter to run specific, secure commands on your nodes for operations not available through the Proxmox API.
settings.sshKeyHint: Paste your SSH private key (OpenSSH format)
settings.sshKeyConfiguredHint: An SSH key is already configured. Leave empty to keep it.
settings.sshPassphraseHint: If your key is protected by a passphrase
settings.sshPasswordWarning: SSH key authentication is recommended for better security.
settings.sshPasswordConfiguredHint: An SSH password is already configured. Leave empty to keep it.
settings.apiTokenHelperEdit: Leave empty to keep the current token
settings.unlockAllFeatures: Unlock all features with an Enterprise license
settings.nodeQuotaExceeded: Node quota exceeded ({current}/{max}). Some features may be restricted.

profilePage.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters
profilePage.ldapPasswordChangeNotice: To change your password, please contact your system administrator or use your directory management tools.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Configure email notifications to receive alerts about migrations, backups, and important events.
notifications.loadErrorFull: Unable to load notification settings. Verify that the orchestrator is running.

rbac.title: RBAC
rbac.unauthorizedOther: Not authorized to view other users' permissions
rbac.dangerousPermission: This permission allows destructive or sensitive actions (delete, modify, manage)

network.title: Network Security
network.rulesEvaluatedTopBottom: Rules are evaluated from top to bottom. Drag and drop rows to reorder.
network.enableFirewallOnNic: To enable firewall on an interface, edit the VM network configuration in the Hardware tab.
network.addSecurityGroupOrRule: Add a Security Group or a direct rule
network.securityGroupRulesApplied: The Security Group {name} rules will be applied to this VM.
network.activateFirewall: Enable firewall to protect your infrastructure.
network.switchToDropZeroTrust: Switch to DROP for a Zero Trust model.
network.infrastructureZeroTrustCompliant: Your infrastructure follows Zero Trust principles.
network.selectConnectionMicroseg: Select a connection to view microsegmentation
network.securityGroupsClusterFeature: Security Groups are a Proxmox cluster feature. In standalone mode, firewall rules must be configured directly at the host or VM/CT level.
network.aliasesDescription: Define names for your networks and IPs
network.vmCtRulesDescription: Configure rules directly on each machine
network.clusterRulesDescription: Cluster rules apply to the entire Proxmox infrastructure.

microseg.title: Micro-segmentation
microseg.subtitle: Zero Trust intra-VLAN isolation
microseg.clickVmToIsolate: Click on a VM to see impact and enable isolation
microseg.gatewayAliasesDesc: For each network net-xxx, an alias gw-xxx points to the gateway ({offset}). This allows traffic to/from the network gateway.
microseg.securityGroupsBaseDesc: Each sg-base-xxx contains 4 rules: allow gateway IN/OUT, block VLAN IN/OUT. This isolates VMs from each other within the same VLAN.
microseg.vmApplicationDesc: Apply sg-base-xxx to each VM, then add business Security Groups (sg-dmz-web, sg-mgmt...) for allowed flows.

configDialog.title: Micro-segmentation Configuration
configDialog.gatewayAddressDesc: Defines the IP offset used for gateways in each network.
configDialog.excludedNetworksDesc: Networks containing these keywords will be excluded from micro-segmentation (Ceph, Corosync, etc.).
configDialog.showExcludedInList: Show excluded networks in the list
configDialog.autoCreateGwAliasesDesc: Creates an alias for each network without gateway
configDialog.autoCreateBaseSGsDesc: Creates a base Security Group for each network

generateDialog.title: Generate micro-segmentation configuration
generateDialog.info: This action will create missing gateway aliases and base Security Groups.
generateDialog.allConfigured: All application networks are already configured!
generateDialog.gwCreationDisabled: Gateway alias creation is disabled. {count} alias(es) will not be created.
generateDialog.noActions: No actions needed - configuration is already complete.

ai.title: AI Assistant
ai.notEnabled: AI assistant is not enabled. Go to Settings → Artificial Intelligence to configure it.
ai.configRequired: Go to Settings → Artificial Intelligence to configure it.
ai.welcomeMessage:
I'm your ProxCenter AI assistant.
Ask me questions about your infrastructure.
ai.inputHelp: Enter to send • Shift+Enter for new line
ai.suggestTopCpu: Which VM consumes the most CPU?

notifications.enabledBody: You will be notified of Proxmox tasks

resources.aiWillAnalyze: AI will analyze your resources and generate personalized optimization recommendations
resources.optimizeScore: Optimize your score by consolidating underutilized VMs
resources.greenNotConfiguredDesc: To display accurate energy consumption, CO2 emissions and cost estimates, you need to configure the Green IT settings for your environment first.
resources.allocationMetricsWillBeShown: Allocation metrics will be shown here
resources.rightsizingInfo: VMs with the highest rightsizing potential based on average usage
resources.topConsumersSubtitle: Top 5 VMs by resource usage over time

rec.cpuHighDesc: Global CPU usage is at {usage}%. Consider adding resources or migrating VMs.
rec.cpuOverDesc: Only {usage}% CPU used despite {allocated} vCPUs allocated. VMs could be rightsized.
rec.ramHighDesc: RAM usage is at {usage}%. Risk of imminent saturation.
rec.storageHighDesc: Storage is at {usage}% capacity. Free up space or add storage.
rec.stoppedDesc: Check if these VMs are still needed. Removing them would free up storage.
rec.cpuUnderusedDesc: {vmName} uses only {cpu}% CPU with {allocated} vCPUs allocated.
rec.efficiencyDesc: Efficiency score of {score}% indicates an imbalance between allocated and used resources.
rec.summaryGoodWithCritical: Infrastructure with {total} VMs, {running} running. Good overall efficiency ({efficiency}%). {criticalCount} critical point(s) need your attention.
rec.summaryBadWithCritical: Infrastructure with {total} VMs, {running} running. Efficiency needs improvement ({efficiency}%). {criticalCount} critical point(s) need your attention.
rec.summaryGoodWithOptimizations: Infrastructure with {total} VMs, {running} running. Good overall efficiency ({efficiency}%). {optCount} possible optimizations identified.
rec.summaryBadWithOptimizations: Infrastructure with {total} VMs, {running} running. Efficiency needs improvement ({efficiency}%). {optCount} possible optimizations identified.
rec.summaryAllClear: Infrastructure with {total} VMs, {running} running. Good overall efficiency ({efficiency}%). No major issues detected.

siteRecovery.title: Site Recovery
siteRecovery.subtitle: Ceph RBD cross-cluster replication & disaster recovery
siteRecovery.noCephDesc: Site Recovery requires at least two PVE connections with Ceph enabled to replicate data across clusters. Enable Ceph on your connections in Settings > Connections to get started.
siteRecovery.oneCephDesc: Site Recovery requires at least two PVE connections with Ceph enabled to replicate data between clusters. Add and configure Ceph on a second connection to get started.

dashboard.rpoComplianceDesc: Percentage of jobs meeting their RPO target
dashboard.noSitesConfigured: No replication sites configured. Add cluster connections with Ceph to get started.
dashboard.noSitesDesc: Site Recovery requires at least one replication job between two Proxmox clusters with Ceph. Configure a replication job to enable disaster recovery, failover plans, and cross-site protection.

protection.noJobsDesc: Create a replication job to start protecting your VMs with Ceph RBD mirroring.
protection.noJobFoundDesc: Modify your filters or create a new replication job.
protection.selectJob: Select a job to view details.

plans.noPlansDesc: Create a recovery plan to define failover procedures for your protected VMs.
plans.selectPlan: Select a plan to view details.

createJob.title: Create Replication Job
createJob.noTags: No tags found on source VMs
createJob.onlineModeDesc: Replicate while VM is running (may impact performance)
createJob.sshChecking: Checking direct SSH connectivity between clusters...
createJob.sshSuccess: Direct SSH connection verified between {source} and {target}
createJob.sshRequirement: Passwordless SSH must be configured between source and target clusters. Ensure root can SSH from source to target without a password prompt.
createJob.vmidPrefixHelp: Prefix added to VM IDs on the target cluster (e.g. prefix 9 + VM 100 = 9100). Leave empty or 0 to keep the same VMID.
createJob.pvNote: Install the <pv>pv</pv> package on source and target nodes to display replication progress.

failover.testDescription: This will perform a non-destructive test failover. VMs will be started on the DR site without affecting the primary site.
failover.failoverDescription: WARNING: This will failover all VMs in this plan to the DR site. The primary site VMs will be stopped.
failover.failbackDescription: WARNING: This will failback all VMs to the primary site. DR site VMs will be stopped and data will be synchronized.

emergencyDR.title: Emergency DR
emergencyDR.noVMsDesc: Configure replication jobs to enable emergency disaster recovery.
emergencyDR.failbackNoPlan: Failback unavailable — VM is not part of a recovery plan

simulation.title: Node Failure Simulation
simulation.subtitle: Click on nodes to simulate failure and see how VMs redistribute

verdict.stressed: Cluster can absorb the load but will be under stress
verdict.allDown: All nodes are down — total cluster failure

simulation.noSimulation: Select a cluster and click on nodes to start the simulation
simulation.cephEnabled: Ceph: guaranteed up to {tolerance} node loss ({osds} OSDs, size {size}/{minSize})
simulation.cephEnabledDc: Ceph: guaranteed up to {tolerance} DC loss ({osds} OSDs, {dcs} DCs, size {size}/{minSize})
simulation.cephOk: Replication safe — {failed}/{max} node(s) down, all PGs have ≥ min_size replicas (pool: {pool}, size {size}/{minSize})
simulation.cephOkDc: Replication safe — {failed}/{max} DC(s) down, all PGs have ≥ min_size replicas (pool: {pool}, size {size}/{minSize})
simulation.cephDanger: DATA AT RISK — {failed} node(s) down exceeds guaranteed tolerance of {max}. Some PGs may drop below min_size={minSize} replicas (pool: {pool}, size {size}/{minSize})
simulation.cephDangerDc: DATA AT RISK — {failed} DC(s) down exceeds guaranteed tolerance of {max}. Some PGs may drop below min_size={minSize} replicas (pool: {pool}, size {size}/{minSize})
simulation.verdictSummary: Surviving {hosts} nodes — avg CPU {cpu}% ({cpuDelta}), avg RAM {mem}% ({memDelta})
simulation.cephRamWarning: {node} at {pct}% RAM — Ceph OSDs need memory headroom, risk of OSD crash

templates.title: Templates
templates.subtitle: VM/LXC template management
templates.convertWarning: This operation is irreversible. The VM will be converted to a template and can no longer be started directly.

catalog.deployTooltip: Deploy this image as a new VM
catalog.noImagesDesc: No cloud images match your filters.

blueprints.noBlueprintsDesc: Create a blueprint to save your favorite VM configurations.

cloudInit.ipConfigHelp: Use ip=dhcp for DHCP, or ip=x.x.x.x/24,gw=y.y.y.y for static

deployments.noDeploymentsDesc: Deploy a VM from the image catalog to see it here.

console.title: Console
console.checkVmStarted: Make sure the VM is started

404.title: Page not found
404.description: The page you are looking for does not exist or has been moved.

500.title: Server error
500.description: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again later.

403.title: Access denied
403.description: You do not have the necessary permissions to access this page.

401.title: Not authenticated
401.description: You must be logged in to access this page.

503.title: Service unavailable
503.description: The service is temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.

errorPages.criticalDescription: A critical error occurred. The application encountered an unexpected problem.
errorPages.unexpectedErrorRetry: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.
errorPages.metaDescription: The page you are looking for does not exist.

vmIsolation.title: VMs
vmIsolation.name: Name
vmIsolation.selectInterface: Select at least one interface to isolate
vmIsolation.vmIsolatedSuccess: VM {name} isolated in {level} mode ({count} SG applied)
vmIsolation.selectInterfaceWarning: Select at least one interface to enable isolation
vmIsolation.standardDesc: IN = DROP, OUT = ACCEPT — Blocks inbound traffic, allows all outbound
vmIsolation.reinforcedDesc: IN = DROP, OUT = DROP — Only gateway allowed (strict Zero Trust)
vmIsolation.affectedVmsInfo: These VMs will no longer be able to communicate directly. Create business Security Groups to authorize flows.

setup.title: Initial Setup
setup.subtitle: Create your administrator account to get started
setup.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters
setup.successMessage: Account created successfully! Redirecting to login...
setup.adminRightsInfo: This account will have full administrator rights on ProxCenter.

bulkActions.confirmStartAll: Start all stopped VMs on this node?
bulkActions.confirmShutdownAll: Gracefully shutdown all running VMs on this node?
bulkActions.confirmStopAll: Force stop all running VMs on this node? This may cause data loss.
bulkActions.confirmMigrateAll: Migrate all VMs from this node to another node?

vmConfig.title: VM Configuration
vmConfig.restartWarning: Some changes require a VM restart to take effect.
vmConfig.name: Name
vmConfig.cpuLimitHelper: 0 = no limit. Limits VM CPU usage.
vmConfig.cpuTypeHelper: "host" for best performance, "kvm64" for migration compatibility
vmConfig.cpuUnitsHelper: Relative CPU priority (default: 1024). Higher = more priority.
vmConfig.balloonHelper: 0 = ballooning disabled. Allows reclaiming unused memory.
vmConfig.balloonInfo: The VM can use between {min} MB and {max} MB of RAM as needed.
vmConfig.memorySharesHelper: Memory allocation priority in case of contention (0-50000)
vmConfig.disksNotImplemented: Disk modification is not yet implemented in this interface. Use the Proxmox interface to manage disks.
vmConfig.biosHelper: OVMF required for Windows 11 and Secure Boot
vmConfig.machineTypeHelper: Q35 recommended for modern VMs and PCIe passthrough
vmConfig.qemuAgentHelper: Enables better integration with Proxmox (clean shutdown, freeze, etc.)
vmConfig.advancedArgsWarning: Manual modification for advanced users only.

hardware.confirmDeleteDisk: Are you sure you want to delete disk {id}?
hardware.confirmDeleteNetwork: Are you sure you want to delete interface {id}?
hardware.moveDiskTo: Move disk to another storage. Current storage: {storage}
hardware.localDiskMigration: Migration with local disk - may take a while
hardware.sharedStorageInfo: Your disks are on shared storage ({storages}). They will remain accessible from all nodes without data copy.
hardware.selectSharedStorageTip: Select a shared storage to migrate your local disks and avoid future copies.
hardware.vmStoppedColdMigration: The VM is stopped. It will be migrated cold (faster).
hardware.fullCopyDescription: Creates a complete and independent copy of the disk
hardware.noNodeAvailable: No other node available in the cluster for migration.
hardware.vmWillStayActive: The VM will stay active during migration
hardware.linkedCloneDescription: Linked Clone: uses source disk as base (faster, less space)
hardware.cpuHostWarning: ⚠️ VM uses cpu:host - Ensure CPUs are similar
hardware.cpuHostDifferentVendor: ❌ Different CPU vendors (Intel vs AMD) - Risky migration
hardware.cpuHostMigrationWarning: Migration with cpu:host may fail or cause instability
hardware.cpuHostMigrationTip: Tip: Change CPU type to x86-64-v2-AES for safe migration, or disable online migration.
hardware.cpuLevelTooHigh: CPU type {vmCpu} is not supported by this node (max: {targetMax})
hardware.cpuHostSimilar: ⚠️ Similar but not identical CPUs - Check compatibility
hardware.cpuHostAllIdentical: All nodes have identical CPUs - Safe migration
hardware.cpuIncompatibleBlocked: Migration blocked: VM CPU is not compatible with this node

crossCluster.lxcNotSupportedDesc: Cross-cluster migration currently only works with QEMU/KVM virtual machines. For LXC containers, consider using backup/restore or manual migration.
crossCluster.haNotSupported: HA-managed VM cannot be migrated cross-cluster
crossCluster.haNotSupportedDesc: This VM is managed by High Availability (HA)
crossCluster.noConnectionsAvailable: No other clusters or standalone nodes configured. Add a connection in Settings to enable cross-cluster migration.
crossCluster.targetVmIdHelp: Leave empty to keep the same VMID
crossCluster.deleteSourceVmDesc: By default, the source VM is kept in a stopped state
crossCluster.liveMigrationDesc: VM will stay running during migration (minimal downtime)
crossCluster.vmStopped: VM is stopped - offline migration will be used
crossCluster.liveMigrationInfo: Live migration requires sufficient resources on the target node and network connectivity between clusters.
crossCluster.validationSuccess: All checks passed - ready to migrate

ldap.description: Configure LDAP/Active Directory authentication to allow users to sign in with their corporate credentials.
ldap.securityInfo: LDAP authentication is secure: credentials are verified directly by the orchestrator, never exposed to the browser.
ldap.enableLdapDesc: Users will be able to sign in with their LDAP/AD credentials
ldap.serverUrlHelper: Use ldaps:// for a secure connection (recommended)
ldap.bindDnHelper: Account used to search for users
ldap.bindPasswordKeep: Leave empty to keep current password
ldap.tlsInsecure: Ignore TLS certificate errors (not recommended in production)
ldap.userFilterHelper: Use {{username}} as placeholder for the entered username
ldap.emailAttributeHelper: LDAP attribute containing the email address
ldap.nameAttributeHelper: LDAP attribute containing the display name

ceph.osdLatency: OSD Latency (ms) - Commit Latency per OSD

rbacPage.limitedToClusters: Limited to one or more PVE/PBS clusters
rbacPage.limitedToNodes: Limited to one or more nodes
rbacPage.limitedToVmsCts: Limited to one or more VMs/CTs
rbacPage.userHasRoleOnAll: The user will have this role on all resources of the infrastructure.
rbacPage.limitedToTag: Limited to VMs with a specific tag
rbacPage.limitedToPool: Limited to VMs in a specific pool

drsPage.sharedStorageSafe: This VM uses only shared storage (Ceph/NFS). Migration will be fast.
drsPage.checkStorageManually: Manually check available space on local storage of {node} before starting the migration.
drsPage.recommendationStale: This recommendation is no longer valid. The VM has been moved or is no longer on the expected source node.
drsPage.recsExplainer: DRS analyzes the memory and CPU distribution across nodes. Even when a cluster is marked "Balanced" (health score above 80), minor imbalances between nodes can still be optimized by migrating VMs from overloaded nodes to less loaded ones.
drsPage.clustersEquilibrated: All clusters are balanced. No action needed.
drsPage.noNewRecommendation: No new recommendation. {count} migration(s) in progress.
drsPage.noNodeInMaintenance: No node in maintenance. All nodes are operational.
drsPage.noAffinityRulesDesc: Use Proxmox tags or create rules manually
drsPage.evacuateAllGuests: Evacuate all guests to other nodes
drsPage.confirmEnterMaintenance: Do you want to put the node {nodeName} in maintenance mode?
drsPage.nodeHostsGuests: This node currently hosts {vmCount} VMs and {ctCount} containers. They will be automatically migrated to other nodes.
drsPage.actionNodeMarked: The node will be marked as "in maintenance"
drsPage.actionNoNewGuest: No new guest will be placed on this node
drsPage.actionGuestsEvacuated: Existing guests can be evacuated manually or automatically
drsPage.actionAffinityRespected: Affinity rules will be respected if possible
drsPage.scoreFormula: 100 - RAM penalty - CPU penalty - imbalance penalty
drsPage.scoreTooltip: Estimated imbalance improvement of {score}% after this migration
drsPage.imbalanceThresholdDesc: Minimum standard deviation to trigger proactive balancing
drsPage.homogenizationEnabledDesc: Actively balances load across all nodes in the cluster
drsPage.maxLoadSpreadDesc: Maximum tolerated gap between the most and least loaded nodes
drsPage.tagAffinity: Keep together on the same node
drsPage.psiPve8Fallback: The following clusters are on PVE 8 and will automatically use "used" mode: {clusters}
drsPage.rulesFromTags: {count} rule(s) automatically detected via Proxmox tags
drsPage.affinityDesc: Keep guests on the same node
drsPage.ruleRequiredDesc: Blocks migrations if impossible to respect
drsPage.haConflictPve9: {rules} native affinity rule(s) detected. Native PVE 9 affinity rules may conflict with ProxCenter DRS placement decisions.
drsPage.haConflictHint: Consider disabling Proxmox native affinity rules if you want ProxCenter DRS to fully manage placement.
drsPage.vmMovedAlert: This VM has been moved since the recommendation was created. The list has been refreshed.
drsPage.recommendationExpiredAlert: This recommendation has expired following a re-evaluation. The list has been refreshed.
drsPage.vmAlreadyOnTargetAlert: This VM is already on the target node. The list has been refreshed.
drsPage.activeClustersHelp: Select which clusters DRS should manage. Leave empty for all clusters.
drsPage.clusterModeOverridesDesc: Override the global DRS mode for individual clusters.

usersPage.newPassword: New password (leave empty to keep current)
usersPage.cannotDeleteSelf: You cannot delete your own account.
usersPage.deleteWarning: This action is irreversible. All role assignments will also be deleted.
usersPage.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters

networkPage.devNoticeDesc: This module is still being developed. Some features may not work as expected and are subject to change.
networkPage.potentiallyAffectedInNetwork: potentially affected in the same network
networkPage.noBusinessSgApplied: No business Security Group applied - only traffic to gateway will be allowed
networkPage.deleteRuleWarning: This action is irreversible. Rule #{pos} on {node} will be permanently deleted.
networkPage.deleteClusterRuleWarning: This action is irreversible. Rule #{pos} will be permanently deleted from the cluster.
networkPage.deleteRuleQuestion: Are you sure you want to delete this rule?
networkPage.noPveConnection: No PVE connection configured. Add a Proxmox VE connection to manage the firewall.
networkPage.basedOnCoverage: Based on firewall coverage, isolation and policies
networkPage.sgNotAvailableStandalone: Security Groups not available in standalone mode
networkPage.clusterRulesDescription: Cluster rules apply to the entire Proxmox infrastructure.

securityMap.title: Security Map
securityMap.noDataDesc: Run microsegmentation analysis to generate the security map
securityMap.applyBaseSg: Apply base Security Group for isolation

deployWizard.bannerDescription: Your cluster has no firewall rules and the firewall is disabled. Deploy essential rules before activating the firewall to avoid losing connectivity.
deployWizard.analysisWarning: Activating the firewall with a DROP policy without whitelist rules will break cluster communication (Corosync, Ceph, migrations…). This wizard will create the essential rules first.
deployWizard.previewDescription: The following {count} rules will be added to the cluster firewall to whitelist essential Proxmox services.
deployWizard.activateWarning: Enabling DROP policy means all inbound traffic not explicitly allowed by a rule will be blocked. The rules created in the previous step ensure cluster services remain accessible.
deployWizard.doneFirewallNotEnabled: Cluster firewall not enabled (manual activation needed)

global.minimal: Ultra clean, thin borders, no shadows

aboutPage.title: About
aboutPage.subtitle: ProxCenter - Centralized Proxmox management
aboutPage.description: Centralized management solution for multi-cluster Proxmox VE environments.

updates.rollingUpdateDescription: Rolling update allows you to update all cluster nodes without service interruption.
updates.strategyDescription: VMs will be automatically migrated to other nodes before update, then migrated back if necessary.
updates.rebootRequiredKernel: A kernel update is included. A reboot will be required.
updates.selectConsole: Select console type to monitor the update:
updates.changelogDescription: Click on a package to see change details.
updates.noChangelogAvailable: No changelog available for this package.
updates.comingSoonDescription: Automatic rolling update execution will be available in a future version.
updates.allCanMigrate: All can be migrated (stopped or replication)
updates.strategyAcceptDowntime: Exclude from rolling update and update manually
updates.cephMustBeHealthy: Ceph must be HEALTH_OK before updating
updates.vmsShutdownHint: VMs will be shut down during the update if the option is enabled below.
updates.autoRebootDescription: Reboot node if a kernel update is installed
updates.shutdownVmsDescription: Shutdown VMs before the update, restart them afterwards
updates.confirmCloseWhileRunning: An update is in progress. Are you sure you want to close? (The process will continue in the background)
updates.nodeOrderDescription: Nodes will be updated in the order below. You can reorder or exclude them.
updates.setCephNoout: Set Ceph noout flag during maintenance
updates.minHealthyNodesHelper: Minimum number of nodes that must remain online
updates.shutdownLocalVms: Shutdown VMs with local storage (if not migratable)
updates.waitCephHealthy: Wait for Ceph HEALTH_OK between each node
updates.checksBlockingIssues: Issues are preventing the rolling update
updates.repoIssuesDescription: Enterprise repositories are enabled without a no-subscription alternative. Update commands will fail without a valid Proxmox subscription. Enable the no-subscription repository or disable the enterprise repository on the affected nodes.
updates.connectedNodeNotLast: The API node (used by ProxCenter to connect to the cluster) is not last in the update order. When this node reboots, the dashboard will be temporarily unreachable until the node comes back online. It is recommended to place the API node last.

replication.title: Replication
replication.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this replication job?
replication.noJobs: No replication job configured for this VM.
replication.noTargetNodes: No target node available (single-node cluster or nodes offline).
replication.cephComingSoon: Ceph RBD cross-cluster replication via Crossover will be available in a future version.
replication.noCephJobs: No Ceph replication job configured for this VM.
replication.cephJobDescription: Ceph replication allows replicating RBD disks of this VM to another Proxmox cluster using Ceph.
replication.noCephClusters: No other Ceph cluster available. Add other Proxmox connections with Ceph to enable cross-cluster replication.

emptyState.noEventsDesc: No events have been recorded yet. Events will appear here when actions are performed on your infrastructure.
emptyState.noAlertsDesc: Everything looks good! No alerts have been triggered.
emptyState.noJobsDesc: No scheduled or running tasks found. Tasks will appear here when operations are executed.
emptyState.noBackupsDesc: No backup data found. Backups will appear here once configured and executed.
emptyState.noUsersDesc: No user accounts found. Create your first user to get started.
emptyState.noConnectionsDesc: Add your first cluster connection to start monitoring your infrastructure.
emptyState.noDrsDesc: No Proxmox clusters with DRS support found. Connect a cluster with multiple nodes to use DRS.
emptyState.noStorageDesc: No storage volumes found. Storage will appear here once your clusters are connected.
emptyState.noCephDesc: No Ceph clusters detected on your connections. Enable Ceph on a Proxmox cluster to see details here.

topology.title: Infrastructure Topology
topology.noDataDesc: Add a Proxmox connection to visualize your infrastructure.
topology.geoNoDataDesc: Set coordinates on your connections in Settings.

cluster.cephNotInstalled: Ceph not installed on this cluster
cluster.cephDescription: Ceph is a distributed storage system that provides high availability, scalability, and excellent performance. Install Ceph on your cluster nodes to enable distributed storage with RBD, CephFS, and Object Gateway support.
cluster.installWizardComingSoon: Installation wizard coming soon - Use Proxmox VE directly for now
cluster.createOrJoin: Create a new cluster or join an existing one
cluster.copyJoinInfoDescription: Copy the Join Information here and use it on the node you want to add.
cluster.assistedJoinDescription: Assisted join: Paste encoded cluster join information and enter password.
cluster.rootPasswordHelper: Root password of the node to join

compliance.retentionHelper: Number of days to keep audit logs
compliance.profilesDescription: Create custom profiles to select which checks to run and adjust their weights.
